description:
Love the calzones here. The filling has always been nice and cheesy and the crust (more bread like) super flavorful. We always order two mediums and have enough left over the next day or two. 

We have also ordered regular pizzas before, which I thought were fine, but the calzones are definitely the star of the show.  Note I am definitely not a pizza snob and I don't understand the appeal of a New York style pizza (which seems to be the main focus of a stereotypical pizza snob). So if New York style pizza is your thing, this review is probably useless to you.
author: Angelito R.

description:
Today we decided to try something new since its our last night here. 

We ordered from Taraval Pizza after coming back from a long day at the Zoo. 

Our order consisted of Gnocci with alfredo sauce, Lasagna Della Casa and garlic bread. A side of bolognese sauce to dip our bread in. 

Well, let's start with the alfredo. It was milk. There was no consistency to it, no flavor at all. The gnocchi was over cooked. 2 bites and it was tossed. Lasagna Della Casa was just lasagna noodles tossed in a pan covered in sauce and cheese. It was not built like lasagna, and no flavor there either. 

The bolognese was a joke. It tastes like canned hot dog chili.  
The garlic bread was the best part of this meal and it wasn't that great.  Way to much rosemary seasoning. Hey, at least it was seasoned, right?! 

So, our dinner is in the trash and we will be dining elsewhere tonight. 

Unless you want to be disappointed,  I wouldn't recommend this place for their pastas.
author: Ashley W.

description: I speak for the pizza slices. They are biiiig slices. Saw some people post small slices. Maybe try them again? Garlic chicken is the best. Those tomatoes make it so good damn juicy. With the onions and peppers mmm mmm. Magnifique.
author: Marco C.

description: Had a slice with mushrooms. It was okay. Average. Not even average, below average. I'd have to eat more to make a more accurate assessment, but from the one slice I ate, nothing special.
author: Mr L.

description:
A picture tells a thousand words. Or it misleads. When I saw a photo of the pizza, I thought it looked like a decent NY style pizza. Man, was I wrong. It wasn't the worst pizza I've ever had, but it was probably pretty close. My husband swears that it came from a box stuffed in the back of a freezer somewhere. The dough was super thick and doughy. And it wasn't quite cooked all the way through. And it was completely flavorless. It was like eating a really thick cardboard. Horrible. The salad was decent, but that's about it. 

Granted, I am an East coast pizza snob and have yet to find great pizza in SF. But there are plenty of places that are worthy, even if they're not perfect. This place is not it. Never again.
author: Amy B.

description: Oh man . That is the pizza spot i like . Slice a pizza is huge and have a lot of topping on it . People there are friendly and have nice attitude
author: Abdullah S.

description: Pesto cheese bread was delicious. The pasta was ok...not great. The staff is not friendly. I won't eat here again.
author: Stacey C.

description: Their $14 pasta plate is thr worst that I've ever had. It's a soggy grease soup. Their sandwiches are not much better.
author: Charles Z.

description: Half a chicken patty? Thanks. Their pizza seems okay but come on. I guess I shouldn't be surprised cause the bag felt light when I picked it up.
author: Kevin H.

description: This place is a must try. Many options and delicious! Some pizza places don't let you purchase slices but they do. I love the location; near other fun foods.
author: Hiba Z.

description: These guys are so rude. I've ordered single slices from them a couple times and it was ok. Then this last time I got my slice and took it home to eat. When I opened the box it was half the size it should be. So I paid 4.50 for a tiny pizza slice. I regret tipping him. Do yourselves a favor and go to north beach down the street. Better service and better quality. And they won't rip you off.
author: Kristie A.

description: If you are a ny pizza lover,  keep scrolling.    Bland, lacking salt and flavor.   Soft, bready crust.  Not my style.
author: Johnny D.

description: This place is my go to place when I need my pizza fix! Very great customer service and on time delivery.
author: Marybeth J.

description: Their Pizza and Calzones are amazing! The dough is fresh and they make everything right in front of you. I used to live in Boston, where I was used to finding good Pizza. I thought I was out of luck in San Francisco, until I found this place. Taraval Pizza more than lives up to my expectations.
author: Azim P.

description: The best calzones in town! I happened to drive by Taraval Pizza on my way home from work, and glad I did. Service was great and didn't take long at all. Sam was very friendly. Must try!
author: Saida J.

description: I order some pizza Grilc chicken it was very testy and spaghetti meatball the SAS   it was amazing  fast delivery the best on the west  check it out
author: Ahmad R.

description: All I can say is if you never tried the chicken ranch pizza your missing out! The dough is simply light and fluffy ! I'll always come back enjoy the delicious freshness of their meats and veggies on all their flavorful pies... Friendly faces makes the atmosphere warm and welcoming ! Hand downs to the cooks.
author: Randa H.

description:
Taraval Pizza came to the rescue as late-night hunger hit. 

I had never tried their pizza before, but I was drawn in by the free delivery and only $15 minimum for delivery. The pizza got to my apartment in a speedy half hour or so, despite the estimated 45-60 minutes.  I had probably the best Hawaiian pizza I've ever had.  The reason? BACON! My roommate loved his combo pizza as well.  Nothing fancy, just good pizza.  Definitely will order again.
author: Nick M.

description: Highly recommend the Philly cheese steak and Chicken cheese steak sandwich. The salads are so good very fresh ingredients-- Caesar Salad is especially good. Mexicana pizza is my favorite pizza. French fries are tasty and plentiful--way too much for one person. Mozzarella sticks are really good too.
author: Lori M.

description: This pizza is heartburn waiting to happen, but it's nice to have a Seniore's alternative pop up. The delivery has always been very quick, and the drivers have been friendly.
author: Jonathan B.

description: The crust at this place is delish. Also, they have the best garlic bread in the city. Seriously.
author: Jon L.

description: We just got a large cheese delivered.  Pretty good.  The crust was nice and crispy.  I found the sound heavy with herbs but not bad.  Enjoyed the pizza.
author: Pauline C.

description:
A week ago, i had decided try this spot instead of the typical seniores. Just got a sliced cheese and it was amazing. The dough was fluffy, buttery and crunchy. They just add fresh cheese on-top of a precooked slice cheese and re-heat. 

Came back yesterday and had a totally differently experience. Asked for a slice of cheese and they just stuck one in the oven without adding fresh cheese on top. Came out of the oven tasting stale and hard. Nothing like my first experience.

Thought i found a new go to place for slice pizza but after this, i will stick with seniores. Maybe ill try again..maybe
author: Calvin K.

description: Ordered from them via Foodler. They never showed to deliver my order . Foodler says they call the restaurant and confirmed my order with them. I called 9 times they never answered
author: Brian C.

description: I absolutely love this pizzaria. The cashier hands a good laugh to me with a soft welcoming every time I step in here. The food is made in front of me so I feel confident it is clean. They are quick and very organized with their work. I made this place my neighborhood pizzaria. This place looks like it need to be acknowledged for their amazing work. Help their awesome performance with me! Go Taraval Pizza!
author: Joe H.

description:
Twice as long as quoted for my pizza. Still waiting. If you quote me a time, stick to it. Don't quote me a time thinking it makes you look good while knowing full well you can't deliver. Come on now. Give an accurate time so I'm not pissed when you come with my food. It's not fair to anyone involved. At this point I may as well cancel. 

Might update review when/if I get my food.
author: Luke P.

description:
I used to really like this place. Their garlic chicken was bomb. 

But when they make your parents starve for 1hr 30min+? That's just ridiculous and gets them the WORST PIZZA DELIVERY award of the century! Just last month, they also took over an hour to deliver pizza in the middle of the day. Thanks for ruining lunch and now dinner. God help them.
author: A W.

description: I have ordered pizza in advance for my kid's elementary school pot luck and it was not delivered, but I was charged. Unfortunately, I was not aware of it until it was late evening. I'm a single mom and I have to work, therefore, I can't take time off to cook and bring food to school on a work day. People in school relied on it and the teacher was too shy to call me. When I called This pizza place, the owner (I think) told me that they forgot. But they didn't forget to charge me. He told me to come and pick up my money!!!! Horrible service. I had to drive there and all I got was my money and a smirk, " sorry."
author: Biana O.

description:
There was a mismatch in info on Eat24's website and the app. Burgers don't come with fries and veggie are not on the actual menu. I know I should've checked with the restaurant itself after seeing the discrepancy, but it was 2:30am and I was hungry. Only 1/3rd of my expected order showed up. When I called, I could tell the employee was honestly confused, as was I. It was Eat24's mistake, not ours. I was told to chat with the manager on the next day, which I did.

The manager was very understanding. Even without veggie burgers on the menu, he made one from scratch with sauteed mushrooms. Eating it right now and it's rather good. Good food and great customer service.
author: Tommy R.

description:
My new favorite pizza delivery spot. I dont mind irving but seniores is just too thick.

Ive asked around and no one would make the more thin like NY crust. 

I simply asked thinner crust 1/2 cheese 1/3 pepperoni. 

delivered in 30 minutes great price for a large, it was delish!! definitely going here again.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Damn, this place is kind of a gem. It's not a NY thin slice, that's for sure, but it's cheap, and my favorite part is the dough. It's a fantastic texture blend of crispy on the outside and doughy/chewy in the interior. Cheese is super heavy on these slices, and the toppings don't ever seem to end, but it's not that crappy west-coast style topping-on-top-of-topping creation. It's more of a topping-blended-into-the-melted-cheese-and-incorporated-into-the-pizza kind of style, and it's freaking delicious. Mind you, you're probably seeking out greasy fare after/during some heavy drinking at the Dragon Lounge, but this place rocks. I definitely recommend the veggie slice.

The place is also pretty small, but you're probably getting it to go anyway.
author: Danny C.

description:
Came here for a slice of pepperoni pizza. And it met my expectations. Nice fat slices, with sauce and pepperoni on the bottom and ample cheese on top. When i first opened my box I thought they forgot the pepperoni... Yea that's how much cheese was on top, it was a blanket of white. 

Bottom line, pizza was great. But it could just be buzzed-me talking
author: Elaine S.

description:
Arrived late on Thursday night last week and not much was open.  Was starving for PIZZA!
Had this place recommended by our hotel and called them up after 11pm.  Not 25 minutes later our pizza was here, right out of the oven.  Very friendly service.  Pizza was good, nothing spectacular but GREAT when you are starving for pizza late at night.
author: Joe T.

description:
Yum! Just moved to the hood and found my new place to get a pie delivered fast. 

Plus ,everyone I dealt with was down to earth and extremely friendly.
author: Keith G.

description: Their pizza is decent. Not horrible but not the best I've had either. Very convenient and it's open late so it's there for those late night munchies. Can't go wrong with pizza!
author: Tiff C.

description: The Perfect Pizza! Ridiculously fresh dough cooked perfectly! Fresh Toppings pilled high! Quality sauce. Friendly helpful staff. Counter for eat in,  accessible parking
author: Shawn O.

description:
Today was the first day i walked in sober and before 12. Thus i believe i am ready to review.

Total visits here is at least 5 now. As i stated earlier mostly arriving drunk late night (open until 3am Thursday-Sunday)

Meatball sound is okay. I feel like it was lacking density meatballs. Ordered today 6.5/10
All meat Sub is also okay. I do not remember much of it. ?/10
Pulled Pork Sub was good as hell 8.5/10

Good employees and chill spot. Going in the future for sure.
T
author: Nathan A.

description: Came to SF for the weekend. I wanted a late night bite and found this small little pizza spot after a night of drinking. I wasn't expecting much out of place but boy was I wrong. I ordered a pineapple and ham slice of pizza. I wasn't expecting a slice to be that big. The service was awesome and the pizza was absolutely delicuous. I've never had a pizza  where the dough was nice and crispy all over. I definitely was not expecting a pizza that delicious, especially one open that late. I only was visiting for the weekend but I had to go back for another slice the next night. Definitely going to come back to this spot when I come visit SF again.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Lack of attention.

Asked for no cheese and got cheese.

Watched the employee handle my money and then handle food with no hand washing in between. He changed gloves after asking.

Said it was for here but received my sandwich in a bag. 

All the grilled chicken and BBQ sauce inside of this $7 French roll creation was quite good but hard to eat considering it wasn't cut in two.

Lack of stars.
author: Jason B.

description: Pizza was adequate, but delivery time was unacceptably late. They kept putting me on hold, the 4 times when I called to see what the hold up was (it was supposed to be 45 minutes to an hour) they just kept saying it was on it's way. After 1 hour 55 minutes I called one last time to cancel, but the hung up on me!! Rude! Pizza finally arrived, but cold and I will not order from here again. I will also warn the hotel I am staying at so that they don't give out their menus anymore.
author: Kasia T.

description: I really enjoy Taraval Pizza!  The gentlemen there are really nice guys, make a yummy pizza and are willing to change things for you to make you happy.  Their salad is really good, too.  When you order an entire pizza, it always comes out like a pizza should: gooey cheese, toasty meats and perfect veggies.  They cut up everything there for the salad and give very large portions.  It's really quick as well.
author: Laura F G.

description:
Dry, reheated pizza... if it wasn't reheated then they have the worst pizza makers ever. 

Got a cheese pizza and they were stingy on the sauce and cheese. So bland. Wouldn't order again.
author: Emma M.

description: The slices are awesome - custom made with any toppings you want, heated to perfection, and delicious.  The folks that work here are also super nice.
author: Paul M.

description: If you're looking for a late night place that's open you can most definitely come here. It's a small pizza place where you just pretty much order to go.  If you're in a rush, do not come here, they take forever and take their sweet time in making your pizza. The pizzas are big portion. It's bland. You can't really taste the cheese, meat, anything really. The pizza was pretty much just to fill up my empty stomach. I suggest try another late night pizza shop if there's another one close by.
author: Sury C.

description: This is only our first time getting delivery from TP.  We've been looking for a good pizza place that does delivery and this may be it.  So far, the pizza itself is passing the demands well, they even like the crust which is a tough challenge.  We like the cannelloni, haven't had good cannelloni since we moved out of NYC decades ago (might only be improved if it had a white sauce option).  It's good even in red sauce.  The sandwiches are delice too.  What was most impressive is that they got it all here to us 15 mins before estimated, points for that.  The guy who delivered made a good point about making sure the person's name on the order was the same as who was accepting it (I forgot we'd ordered under my partner's Yelp account, not my own, we'd looked at a bunch of delivery places already so I just forgot) and of course I couldn't remember exactly what we ordered because it's been raining for 40 days and 40 nights and my mind is soggy.  But we cleared it up, was nice that he was worried about getting the food to the correct people since I've had deliveries from other places where the guy just leaves the bag outside the door where anyone could lift it.  Now, just keep up the good work TP and we'll be back for more.
author: Kai T.

description:
A worthy spot for cheap, late night eats in the Parkside. You can grab a slice or order a whole pizza. A slice of cheese pizza is $2.50. You can add toppings to the cheese pizza, a 1 topping slice is $3, 2 toppings $3.25, 3 toppings for $3.50.

* Slice of pizza with prosciutto, fresh garlic and mushrooms ($3.50). It takes a few minutes for them to heat up the pizza with your choice of toppings. The slice has a thick, chewy crust with extra crunchy edges. The pizza wasn't greasy and the toppings were tasty...but it needed a more flavorful sauce. The thickness of the crust makes the slice quite filling. 

The shop is small and primarily functions as a takeout place, though they have a few stools. It's similar to Seniore's but I like Seniore's a bit better.

$10 credit card minimum.
author: Lolia S.

description: On two occasions in the span of two weeks, i have ordered from Taraval pizza for a quick dinner with my bf. Unfortunately both times were met with order mishaps. The first order i places was for two salads, and a medium pizza. When the order arrived, we were missing a salad and had to call the place to explain what happened. they sent the second salad right away. the second order we placed was for one large pizza only. when the pizza arrived, it was extremely burnt in the center and the pieces were not uniformly cut. some were tiny slivers while others were large. because of how close this place is to our house, we will probably continue to order from here. just won't have high expectations
author: Ashley R.

description: Order for pick up. Order a medium and ask for the large upgrade. Go down in 20 minutes. You need the exercise anyway. pick up hot smoking pizza. eat one slice on the walk home. get home add parmesan and chilli flakes. add ranch and bbq. lick the top of the bottles as you put them back in the fridge. argue over the last slice. live your life like a boss.
author: Thousand Words P.

description:
Don't even bother

Served me cold pizza

Toppings were dry 

Had to microwave it when i got it

Not worth it. Go to seniores.
author: Reuben D.

description: Placed an order, and it was New Years Eve,so I can understand delays, but the order was incorrect and when we called, we were told they'd "take care of us next time". When my partner asked what he was supposed to do that evening for food, he was placed on hold for 20mins. He called back, explained the situation again, placed on hold again, then someone picked up the line and hung up. Called a third time and he asked what was he supposed to do for this evening for food and they replied "Do you want me to lie to you or we'll just take care of you tomorrow we're too busy."  To which my partner hung up and said he'd call back tomorrow. Huge disappointment as this was our first time ordering from here and likely last.
author: Stephen V.

description: Generous with cheese!! They will treat you like family! Sam remembered my name! And, everyone there is so friendly and the food is like a hidden gem! So good!
author: Andrew A.

description:
Stopped by for Pizza by the Slice. Pretty good, quality ingredients and not canned mushrooms or anything. Really nice when I got it piping hot. 
+Cheese is the good stuff that follows you and you bite and stretch it. 
+Crust is not soggy, and crisp from inside of the pizza to the crust. 
+Was not overly sauce, just right.
+Good Local Pizza shop in the area.
author: Dustin T.

description: 3 hours later and calling twice, they said it was on the way. I never got the pizza and they lied and said it was delivered. Now I'm trying to get my money back this place is a joke.
author: Greg H.

description: I ordered the "all meat" sandwich and when I got home and opened up the sandwich I was blown away to find no meat just 6 pepperonis and a piece of ham. Most disappointing sandwich I've ever had the displeasure of eating should be called the "all bread"
author: Zach B.

description: Don't see myself going back to seniores in the foreseeable future. Had ordered some yummy sandwiches, fries, and wings but for years avoided ordering their pizza, it just didn't look that amazing in pictures but WOW once you taste it there is no going back! They do the perfect version of my fav pizza, (Greek pizza) mixing pesto with the marinara sauce! amazing crust, thick delicious cheese, and fresh ingredients.
author: Ashley H.

description:
Horrible!!! The delivery guy just dropped the food on my doorstep then ran back to his car. The food was disgusting. I ordered the linguine del mare and the seafood smelled rotten. The shrimp was rubbery, the noodles soggy, and the sauce was watery. The jalapeño poopers were cold and fell apart in their laughable exude for marinara dipping sauce. The worst part is they forgot part of my order and after calling back several times they flat out refused to bring the food that I'd already paid for.
Do not order from this dung hole!!!
author: Bud O.

description: so bad. I thought to myself "how bad can anyone screw up pizza?" and i found out the answer at Taraval Pizza. I think the homeless guy i gave my leftovers to was probably wondering the same thing.
author: Suzanne H.

description: I ordered from Grub Hub and they were fast. I like the fries. The spaghetti dish was not great, its like they didn't have enough sauce so they added water. So that drowned out the taste and it was runny  and there was no meat sauce which i had ordered.
author: Marie M.

description: I ordered a pizza through the phone. It was ready as promised but the pizza tasted like it was reheated and not fresh. I was also charged 24.99 for a Md Hawaiian. I asked why but the cashier just told me "that's just the prize we have" and left it at that.
author: Allison V.

description:
The other reviews made me scared to try this place, but this pizza was super good! My pizza-lovin-cousin had us eat here twice in 2 days! 

We both bought a slice and it was super filling. (And we like to eat a lot!) 

We also loved that each slice was made to order. 

This place is a lot better than highly rated places in the city. We're coming back for sure.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Nothing can go wrong with cheese, pesto, chicken strips and bacon bits, right? I customized my pizza and had it delivered for the first time. The food came on time(35 mins approx) and I'm satisfied with the service, just my pizza was oversalted.
author: Yanakon D.

description:
I DON'T UNDERSTAND WHY THEY ONLY HAVE 3 STARS! CMON GUYS... 

Literally, they have the best chicken in sunset area. I have never eaten at the place since I am a night owl and order delivery really late. BUT, the customer service seems pretty nice on the phone (even though I call them really drunk sometimes hehe) 

Chicken wings are on point. I order 24 every time and all 24 of them taste amazing. AND I STILL WANT MORE EVERYTIME! 

Don't know much about their pizzas though.
author: Nery Z.

description: Worst pizza I ever had in my life! The wing i could have swore were over a year old and just reheated. The pizza was bland as hell, the sandwich had no flavor and the fries we're stale, the only good thing about this place or should I say normal, was they're can soda lol
author: Lance L.

description: Amazing pizza!!! Always get my pizza just the way I like it here.. They always have great service, pizza, and sandwiches. The owner is really friendly and always makes sure your satisfied. I recently tried the philly steak sandwich which you guys MUST try!!!! This is the spot to go to.
author: Diana B.

description: Around 3am, my friends and I got off at the wrong bus stop coming home from a night of bar hopping. We were walking by and thought it would be a good idea to get some food since we were half drunk and starving. The guy at the front was very welcoming, and we didn't have to wait very long for our food. My boyfriend and I split a small cheese and pepperoni calzone (IT WAS HUGE, I'm glad we split it) and it was pretty damn good. We normally frequent a different pizza place, but we will definitely be coming back to Taraval Pizza.
author: Lexi T.

description:
To borrow from another Yelper's pizza place review: "Potentially the most disgusting food I've had... ever. I'd rather lick the freezer burn off of my roommates moldy tater tots."

True that. 

This place also delivered in a little more than the hour they quoted, which is a bit sad given how close I live. The guy offered his apologies, "Sorry man. Another customer literally wanted to fight me." This is supposed to inspire confidence? Apparently they'd delivered the wrong order to someone else and got into a spat over it.

I ordered everything that was not a pizza but still terrible for you. Beef tortellini. Jalapeno poppers. Fries. A baked chicken and ranch dressing sandwich. Garlic bread. Cat food would have been better than the tortellini. Everything else I mentioned was way over salted. The poppers tasted like they came out of a bulk freezer bag.

I'm not that down on this place because they delivered what I ordered in a reasonable time, and they were sorry when they didn't really need to be. But I doubt I'll order again.
author: David S.

description:
Living on the block, I tend to try most of the places to eat on Taraval. Some are great, some aren't. This one falls into the second category.

It was about 8PM, we were hungry, so I pulled a menu I had from this place, which I had not tried before, and thought, let's give it a shot. We ordered the following items -- their menu price is listed after the item:

Lasagna della Casa (8.95)
Garlic Bread (2.29)
Antipasto Salad (5.49)
Hot Wings (4.99)
Medium Calzone + 3 toppings (11.99 + 1.25 x 3 = 15.74)

Okay math wizards -- adding in the 9.5% sales tax means the grand total would come to 41.02, rounding up. I would note that on the phone I mentioned that I had a $5 off coupon (to which he replied, "No problem, boss.") -- so my grand total (at the most) should be $36.02. Remember this.

The food arrived in a reasonable period of time, but when the driver comes, I look at the receipt: $44.47. "Hang on," I say, "this is way to high, man."

"Did you get the new menu?"

"Did you raise prices across the board by like $8? And there's no coupon on here."

"Did you get the new menu?"

"Can I keep this itemized copy of my receipt?"

"No - I need that. Did you get the new menu?"

I signed and went upstairs -- with no itemized receipt!! -- and checked out the grub.

"How's the lasagna?" I ask. "Mediocre. The salad isn't bad, but how can you screw up salad? How are the hot wings?"

"It tastes like vinegar. Not spicy, not tasty -- just straight up vinegar in the sauce. The garlic bread is OK -- a little greasy and overcooked, but standard."

"And the calzone?"

"It looks like they went to Pizza Hut once, bought one of those janky P'Zone pizzas, then tried to replicate it - even with the overuse of garlic powder / cheapo Kraft type Parmesan sprinkled on the outside. No sauce inside -- but at least they gave me a tiny cup of some tomato sauce that tastes like it was made in Chef Boy-R-Dee's cannery."

"So you didn't like it?"

In a word -- no. I don't like crappy pizza places that try to make a quick buck with the "the menu is expired" (of note -- I got the menu about a week ago) BS, sell crap food, and play dumb when called on it. Even the greasiest pizza on Taraval (I'm talking to you, Pirro's) is better than putting up with that sort of scam, but when you pair it with some of the worst calzones / hot wings around, there's absolutely no point in coming to this place. 

This goes beyond "avoid" to "tell everyone you know not to ever go to" level.

So, though we may not know each other, let me tell you about this place called Taraval Pizza...
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Dirty place. Pizza is no better than frozen.
I wanted 2 slices but they told me ordering a small pie would be faster- of course it cost more money.
I will never go back here.
author: Ilene L.

description:
Personally this might be one of the best pizzas I've eaten. I have not tried their other dishes, but it's a pizza place. So naturally just trust the pizzas. 

Most pizzas out there you eat will have a tough crust where you'll need the strength of your neck to kind of tear the pizza on top of biting it. THIS pizza although looks thick, has a crust unlike anything I've tried before. It is sturdy, has volume, but when you bite it, crust crumbles perfectly and melts with the toppings in your mouth. I thought only a thin crust can give such an effect. But these guys have a dough that might be revolutionary. 

It's a 3 man team, so don't count on delivery unless you live really nearby. But if you drop by the shop the'll pop your pizza in within 5 mins and will be freshly baked in 15 mins. They seem like real Italians, but I can't confirm. 

Definitely try this place out.
author: Ken T.

description:
Ok, I'll be completely honest, this review is for a catering order I had with Taraval Pizza. I've used yelp for 4 years without a single review, but they screwed this up so bad, I had to come out as a reviewer. 

Asked for 25 sandwiches delivered to UCSF at 11:45am today with 2 days notice. They had to be cut in half to accommodate the 50 people attending and on time for a 12pm lecture. Lastly, I gave my corporate credit card info 3 times over phone. Here's what I got:

12:30pm delivery, completely ruining / interrupting lecture.
No cut sandwiches, people went hungry 
Failed billing because owner cant take a CC number over the phone. 
No itemized receipt and I'm out $160 as of now. Will have to make another trip to get receipt. 

If you plan to dine in, disregard this review. If you plan to order large, look elsewhere
author: Ben P.

description:
I was a customer for 3 years! 
I am no longer! 
This last order took them over 2 hours to deliver my food. ( I live less then 10 blocks away)!  I ended up not getting my food ! When I called to complain about this they were rude!
Overall they don't listen to instructions and are apathetic to pleasing customers. I recommend a different pizza place on Taraval!
author: Big H.

description:
I've eaten their pizzas several times and was pleased. The price was right. The food seemed very good and very hot, even when delivered. My Will-Call order was ready sooner than I expected. The staff seemed very friendly. The late night customer crowd is cool too.

This is important to me: I've never seen their delivery guys driving too fast or breaking driving laws. The the food delivery landscape is changing, but delivery drivers have historically been bad. Taraval Pizza (TP) is a tiny spot and I think they have just a counter for eating there. 

One thing I think detracts from generating business on what looks like a fairly well-traveled block is this: the TP guys take breaks, hanging out at different locations on the block, looking mopey. 

This includes in standing front of other businesses (and sometimes even sitting on non-Parklet chairs of a nearby eatery-coffee shop, smoking  and talking on the phone with not even a coffee cup to show they gave spent money there). They lean on poles, smoke, and talk on cells. Sometimes it's in front of their own business but not always. I'd imagine that, like panhandlers, it may deter business. If I were a merchant I'd try to assess if this scared away business. The nearby proprietors are really nice and may not care. To me it has an irresolute flavor or aura to it, and it seems inconsiderate. 

Other Languages spoken there:  Portuguese, Spanish, Arabic ?
author: Robert F.

description:
You see those hours? Open til 2:45am every night. Which makes it the only option for late night pizza around here if you need it. The fact that it also happens to be pretty good pizza earns it an automatic 4 stars.
Rest assured, they will make a fan out of you after only one slice. The wait may be a little annoying depending on how busy it is, but in your state of mind, it will make the slice you end up getting that much better. And $2.50 for a good slice of cheese pizza is a pretty great value.
author: Vanessa H.

description: Ordered 2 pizzas through the eat24 app. Great service. Very useful app. The toppings were awesome and slices were nice and thick.  The tomatoe sauce was on point. I highly suggest their pizza.
author: Adrian P.

description: Driver called me and asked me to meet him because he didn't want to get out of the car. I couldn't because I was working. Called the restaurant and they said the driver told them that he didn't want to get out because there were people smoking weed. He never mentioned this to me and I know it was a lie because I could see where he was at and everything around him from a camera feed.
author: Victor T.

description: Burnt pizza and takes like an hour. The people who work here bring their super annoying friends in there and they just linger and distract the employees from doing their job. Very unprofessional and they've forgot to place my pizza order in numerous times. They kicked my brother and I out last time because we asked about where our two slices of CHEESE Pizza went. Hint to staff: Get your s#%! Together!
author: Anastasia P.

description: Just decent pizza for delivery on those late nights. I'm not a fan of the cheese though. It has the consistency of string cheese, that kind of unpleasant rubbery-ness.
author: Maya S.

description:
Taraval Pizza is one of my local pizza spots. I'm not a big crust person but I particularly prefer their crust over many others. On most nights, they're often a good go-to for pizza. But I did have one occasion more recently where the pizza arrived a bit on the dryer side. My impression and vivid imagination led me to believe that someone may have cancelled their plain cheese order, then I chimed in, added a few toppings, and voila, have a reheated pie sent my way. This was definitely an off-night that had a good explanation I'm sure as they've usually offered consistently good quality.  

The jalepeno poppers are delicious, fresh jalapeno peppers and cream cheese lightly deep fried. Yum with or without the marinara sauce! The buffalo wings are also good though nothing to write home about. 

All in all, Taraval Pizza is ok in my book. Good service, great delivery time, good pizza with more than satisfied customers.
author: Charles J.

description:
I never really see people in here other than the people that actually works here. Lincoln students will come around but that is because they are down the hill. Most people would rather go to Seniore's Pizza instead because there are always people there at odd hours. 

People only seem to want delivers from this place, thus why the cars blocking off Taraval each day.
author: M C.

description:
Brunette delivery guy was extremely rude and called me a f***** Chinese due to a misunderstanding during the delivery. This guy barely spoke English and he was trying to pull out a racial slur, which was pretty odd to me. Also, just because I am Asian, does not mean I'm Chinese...pretty unbelievable. Anyways, I did not get my food at all, and they charged my card fully. Should have called for a refund, but unfortunately I did not want to deal with such a bad business.

After ordering from this place for so long, I was astounded by how much they don't care about customer service, and have the audacity to insult customers.
author: Anna T.

description:
I live across the street. I could eat here, yet, somehow I can't bring myself to diss Seniore's like that. 

In a few respects, Seniore's and TP share many similar characteristics: pizza by the slice around 3-4 bucks, apathetic employees, late-night delivery service every night, and they're both off L-Taraval. But for some reason Seniore's is always busy between 12-3, and Taraval Pizza, well, it's not. Something is a little off about this place, but I can't exactly put my finger on it.

One issue I do have is the credit card limit. It's a 10 dollar minimum, which I usually do not have a problem with. But if you sell pizza by the slice, you might want to consider changing that minimum. One night my boyfriend and I decided to grab a slice. We saw the minimum charge rule and put our order together, ordering two slices and two sodas. The total was $9.96 or something ridiculously close to 10, but they made me order something else! Pretty lame. Seniore's doesn't have a minimum at all.

Another thing, their garlic bread was a big disappointment. It tasted like special garlic-flavored I Can't Believe It's Not Butter on stale french bread. 

One thing I think it's important to point out is TP might be the spot for delivery on busy nights. If you live in the Sunset and you think Seniore's might be busy, save yourself some time and order from Taraval Pizza.
author: Amanda C.

description: I use to come here for lunch when I went to Lincoln High! Oh the memories.. I revisited this place the other day after going clubbing. It's open late and the owners are hilarious and so nice! I ordered the California Combo (~$4). They put it in the oven so its nice and hot when they give it to you. Perfect for late night drunchies!
author: Daniel S.

description:
The pizza is OK but the service can be shitty at times. The staff isn't really the friendliest around and the place is really small. They give you a fair amount of toppings but it is just like any other pizza joint. Nothing really stand out. The thing that I really like about this place is that it is open until the wee hours. This is a great spot to go after the bar or club when your stumbling home. The pizza is cheap and fills you up so I guess it does it's job. The location is great because the L stops right in front. It can get busy during the wee hours because guess what, everyone has the same idea you have! Yeah your not that smart. 

All in all, ehhhhh
author: Javier G.

description:
I've been ordering pizza from these guys for the past 3 years and I have yet to be disappointed. The crust is something I usually don't eat unless the dough is good, but these guys know how to bake their dough.

I've had two times that the delivery guy was over an hour wait, but that's not bad out of all the times I've ordered from them. 

One time I had a party at my house and the delivery guy accidentally dropped one of the pizza boxes on the ground. The box never opened but the slices inside were jumbled around. I told him that that was OK since the pizza never fell out. He immediately apologized, let me keep the pizza, and brought me a brand new pie a half hour later. Great service and great pizza!
author: Michael S.

description: Great little late night spot for a slice.  Very friendly and the burgers are very good.
author: Sonny G.

description: This is the worst place to buy anything to eat when you are starving and getting slides they are not ready and they are racist... Worst place ever...!!!
author: Francisco C.

description: Guy serving us held the pizzas with his bare hands when transferring onto the plates. Also smells like restroom air freshener inside.
author: Christopher Columbus E.

description: Will never order from here again.  Their "Delivery guy" doesn't actually deliver to your door....just calls from downstairs and expects you to go to him.  This has happened twice now and last time I asked him "Don't you actually deliver?"  His response was "I don't want to leave my car."  Really? WTF?  It was a perfectly sunny clear evening, with ample parking spaces right in front of my apartment, which was where he was waiting for me.  The jerk didn't even bother coming to the door.  On top of that their pizza is sub-par and really bland and many of their dishes are watery.  Much better at Seniore's and Di Buffalo in the same neighborhood.
author: Sean M.

description: TELL ME WHY THE FUCK MY LASAGNA IS LIKE A DAMN SOUP!?!?! You think it's acceptable to give your PAYING customer a soup when they ordered lasagna!? NO! I wouldn't pay a penny for this "lasagna"  I'm especially mad because I just waited 30 minutes for my "lasagna". Don't waste your time and money at this shit hole. You're better off eating at Deny's!!!!
author: Brittany K.

description: I ordered pizza and garlic bread 11:02 am. They confirmed with 45-60 min. In 50 minutes I called to check on my delivery and guy on phone told me "give me 15 minutes more, it's in the oven already". It's morning and I live in 5 blocks. Pizza takes 20 minutes to made it, and 10 more to deliver it. Just tell me are they that slow or just bad time management? And in 70 minutes it's still not arrived.
author: Katya P.

description:
Worst pizza I've had in ages. The Martguerita pizza was so full of garlic that I've had indigestion for an entire day. It was drenched in olive oil, greasy and unappealing.

Never again.
author: Monarch B.

description:
We do quite a few jobs in the city and sometimes leaving for lunch is just not an option.  I called seniores pizza and they were booked 1.5 in advance for deliveries.  These guys delivered in around 45 mins during lunch time.  The pizza was good and so were the chicken wings.

The only thing I thought was a bit sketch was when I kept asking him the price for certain menu items he would take me in a circle and not give me a direct answer... Other than that I would order again. 

Oh yeah they also brought me regular coke instead of diet coke (I can't have regular coke)
author: Omar V.

description:
Taraval Pizza has been my favorite place for many, many years! Sure....I have tried other pizzas that friends have brought over BUT nothing compares to Taraval Pizza. The ownership and staff are WONDERFUL and I have NEVER had a problem with delivery and service! To me they are ONE-IN-A-MILLION. Even friends from Santa Rosa come all the way down here to have their favorite pizza!!!!

If you haven't guessed, to me they are the BEST PIZZA IN SAN FRANCISCO...BAR NONE!.

Helen Hultman
author: Helen S. H.

description:
This is my first time trying pizza from here. I had the Toscana pizza with a thick crust, artichoke, pesto sauce, pine nuts, garlic, and cheese. When I brought it home, it was very good! All of it. 
The man of making the pizza was friendly and was very good at multi-tasking 1) making my pizza, 2) taking orders from other walk-ins, 3) talking on his blue tooth, and 4) running the register. 

I took a quick look at the menu and will definitely come back and try the other dishes.
author: Sally P.

description: I accidentally ordered from this place versus another pizzeria on Taraval last night, and boy was I sad. Not only did it take an hour to be delivered, it was on the expensive side and SUUUUPPPEERRR gross. I actually muscled through two pieces to stave off my incredible hunger (especially after waiting an hour to eat) and then threw the rest away. Before I realized what happened I was going to call and demand a refund due to the intense drop in quality. I wouldn't even eat this nastiness drunk at 1 in the morning. :(
author: Rachel H.

description:
Great non-greasy pizza perfect for when you have the late night muchies from drinking.

Made fresh when we got there to order.  But it took too long considering we were the only 2 customers there. They were not receiving any late night phone orders so it's not like they had a crap load of orders to fill.

Either they ran out or are the type of business to make new pizza by the slice after you order but at 12:30 - 1:00 am, we didn't really feel like waiting.  The guys were nice and and friendly.  Prices are decent as well.

Appreciated the large selection of categories to choose from in terms of pizza, pasta, and even salads.  I'd say this is on my top 5 pizza places.
author: Hanna Y.

description: I had had it before, so I knew better, but roommates decided to get pizzas from here instead of our usual without telling me.  Tried to be open minded, but ended up just angry having to pay for it.  Basically, Incredibly expensive, greasy, disappointing pizzas.  Pizza is pretty much the cheapest food to produce outside of peanut butter and jelly, so if it's going to cost akin to feeding us all steak someplace sit-down, it had better be good--here, it isn't even close.
author: Eyre C.

description: I think these guys mean well, but the pizza is just not good. The sauce is bland, and the crust is like eating a loaf of bread.
author: Rich D.

description: Where do I begin...the pizza took an hour and 10 minutes to be made and delivered 10 blocks away...the pizza was not the pizza I ordered....it was cold...it was not that good.  The only reason I give it two stars is because I thought I was calling Seniores, so that was my bad.
author: Kay W.

description:
The line at the all you can eat spot two doors down was wicked long and i had to eat something.  Walked past this place a few times and it seemed to be busy with people coming in and out orders being delivered so the food must be good/great!  

i was WRONG! The prices are significantly higher than what I am use to paying.  I was hungry and the guy promised that it would take 10 minutes.  Sure enough it came out quick, but was quickly feeling duped as the Garlic Chicken Pizza had barely any chicken on it!  No other ingredients to speak of.  Not amazingly fresh.  Ended up paying close to 25 for nothing more than bread and cheese!  

The pizza  does come out burning hot so that is nice for both delivery and instore meal.  Once the pizza cools its not that great and no better than store bought frozen pizza.  Crust was pretty good, but the low quality ingredients and atmosphere really hurt this place.
author: Stan L.

description: all i have to say is awesomeness... after a really long night. the pizza's here have the most amazing crusts.
author: Ann T.

description:
1. Damn good pizza by the slice.
2. Slice is made to order; baked while you wait.
3. Crust is excellent; thick and crispy on outside, doughy on inside.
4. Big slices, low prices. 

Bottom Line: I'm going back!
author: John W.

description: Well don't come here after midnight, there was 4 of us and we each order 1 slice each, it took them more than 30minutes to get our pizza to us. And we saw them drop my friend's slice and had to make another one but they didn't even apologize for the ridiculous wait. The pizza was decent, the slice was huge but the service was horrible.
author: Karen D.

description:
After a night of a few bars on Taraval, my buddies and I needed some grub. I was sober, so I was pretty hesitant on getting some late-night greasy pizza.  Luckily, Taraval Pizza has plenty of options, with many of them being veggie. The pizza place is meant for take-out or delivery, but there is about four or five stools available to enjoy your slice.

The menu is pretty broad with a large selection of signature pizzas, baked sandwiches, pasta, baked pasta, seafood pasta, appetizers, and salads.  I went with their Chicken Pesto baked sandwich.  The sandwich was made to order and took quite a while to come out, roughly 20 minutes.

The sandwich is served on French bread and included chicken, pesto, tomato, lettuce, pickles and onions.  The sandwich was average, and nothing special to rave about. The sandwich could have benefited by having more pesto, as the chicken lacked flavor.  Nevertheless, the sandwich was not a total loss and a rather healthy alternative to ordering a pizza.  Since I didn't try their pizza, I can't compare it to Seniore's, but if you're eating Seniore's, you'll probably be okay eating Taraval Pizza.
author: Alexander E.

description: Just had 2 medium pizza delivered for $19.99. Special offer they have with 2 toppings. Best deal in Sunset. They're delicious and seem bigger than other pizza places. Can't go wrong for 20 bucks. Also delivered in 30 minutes.
author: David M.

description:
Ended up here wanting pizza late night while hanging out in the sunset and not wanting to deal with the Seniore crowd. It was empty, so you might assume their pizza was lacking. Definitely not the case.

After I ordered a cheese slice, I saw that it was being topped with fresh cheese before it was popped in the oven. Before I knew it, a hearty-sized portion of gooey, melty goodness was handed to me. As opposed to Seniore's (I'm really not trying to knock Senire's), it was nice to have a conversation over slices without having to speak over a crowd. I'll definitely be back.
author: Andrew N.

description: No stars - never showed on a seamless delivery - never provided a driver number and then closed with no notice of where/ when driver was coming.  Driver never showed.  Had to get refund through seamless.  Do not trust this restaurant to deliver.
author: Michael C.

description: This will be a quick one. I ordered a delivery to my hotel room. The hotel was 8 minutes away by car and it took them 1 hour and 20 minutes to deliver the pizza and wings. The wings were okay and the Specialty Combo pizza was good. I was shocked that the order was actually correct despite the enormous communication difficulties I had with the man on the phone. Not bad for the middle of the night, but could improve.
author: Nick M.

description:
The food was fine. The service was slow. 

I ordered delivery last night and was told that it would take about 45 minutes to an hour. Okay. As long as we have our expectations straight, even though I think an hour is the sort of wait you have for larger jobs at the edge of the delivery limits. I'd ordered one pizza and I don't live very far away, but if it took an hour, it took an hour.

It took about an hour and forty-five minutes. At least it arrived warm and tasting fairly fresh, so there was that. But I would have appreciated some acknowledgement of my wait--especially as the delay put us past other local places and the supermarket closing and we would have no other food options available. 

That'll learn me. I'll probably stick with Buffalo di Mozzarella because at least when I order from them, I get it about 20 minutes. 

However, the pizza from Taraval was tasty and the other food was perfectly fine in quality. Now if they can just get the bugs in their delivery sorted out or provide more accurate assessments of when I can expect my food, we'd be fine.

EDITED TO ADD: After reading through other reviews, I note that at least two other folks had delayed delivery issues. So this doesn't seem to be a one-time mistake. It seems if you pick up or eat in, you're probably fine, but avoid delivery.
author: Lis M.

description:
To be fair, I have given this place 4 chances. FOUR chances to impress me just a little, but still nothing. The first time I came to this place, I was looking at a room to rent around the corner and had some extra time and a talking stomach. I ordered a cheese slice and a water. The slice took 15 minutes to be ready and the first bite I tooked burned the roof of my mouth immediately. Like, the second I took the pizza out of my mouth the skin was gone. Not good. Needless to say it took awhile for me to try again.

The second time I ordered online (thru Grub Hub), paid with a card, and when I went to pick it up, the guy told me it wasn't a good idea to order online, something about it "taking too long" Um, ok, whatev. The other 2 times I ordered delivery. It was slow (its just around the corner! Yes, I'm lazy. I work hard, I come home, I'm tired, what can I say?) Anyway, the pizza just needs more stuff on it. The cheese portion is miniscule. I ordered a pizza with pine nuts (75 cents xtra) and I think I got 1 pine nut per slice. It was depressing. More toppings, please!!!! The mozarella sticks are good though....

The short of it: I'll probably be ordering from Seniore's from now on.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Yum.  At 2 in the morning, this stuff hits the spot.  I'm pretty sure it hits the spot at other times during the day, but we usually trickle over here a little later in the evening if you know what I mean...

Things I like:

- Open late.
- Delivery late.
- Crunchy crust, but still dough-y enough.
- Yummy cheese!
- Good portions!

It's nothing fancy, but definitely delicious!!!
author: Ashley S.

description:
I've bought slices here and had a whole pizza freshly made, and there is a substantial difference between the two experiences. For slices I would not recommend this place at all. I bought two slices, a pepperoni and mushroom and a veggie. They don't make several pizzas and have you choose; instead they keep a cheese pizza made, put toppings on that then more cheese on top and then heat it up for a bit. The result were two nasty slices that cost me about $8 together. They were huge though, so if you're drunk it's still a good idea.

The pizza I had that was made to order (I think a pesto chicken pizza) was much better, so if you want a whole pizza this place will work just fine.
author: Joseph N.

description:
I love this place. My bf and I always order for pick up for our late night munchies/snacks. There was a few times that the pizza was kinda dry but they already fixed that problem! Thx!!

I just love how the pizza always have the right amount flavors and that the toppings are always fresh. Also, my pizza is always crunchy and not soggy. We tried out many pizza places around sunset and this is by far one of my favorite places. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.
author: Diana P.

description:
I use to come here when I attended high school at Lincoln, so it's always nice to revisit the past. Their pepperoni is different, but in a good way! So every time I come here, I always order myself a slice of pepperoni pizza.

Service is usually speedy, the restaurant has about 4 seats, and it's usually cold in there! I always order to go. Customer service kind of lacks, they could use more hospitality, but ehh I usually come for food anyways. They take credit cards as well which is nice, but charging 50 cents for ranch is a no-no for me, I mean come on it's a pizza joint.
author: Austin N.

description:
Just moved to the neighborhood, and I thought I'd try out my nearby pizza joint. I was really happy that I could order whatever I wanted on my slice of pizza, and it would be made fresh. Having ordered a pepperoni and black olive (my absolute favorite), I was pretty excited. The slice was huge, and the toppings were ample. I personally am not a fan of putting pepperoni UNDERNEATH the cheese, I like mine to be crispy and plainly visible. It adds something to the flavor and texture.

Flavor seemed to be the problem with this pizza, and is why I'm giving it three stars instead of four or five. There plainly wasn't enough sauce, and what sauce there was it was pretty bland. They need seasoning! I imagine they just use straight up tomato paste, no herbs or spices added what so ever. 

Would I go back? Yes, I've been there twice now. I gave it an extra star for being a 5 minute walk away. If I'm feeling to lazy to walk to the other place, or take a train to my favorite pizza-by-the-slice in Union Square, then I'll be here.
author: Matt B.

description:
I ordered the Veggie Deluxe and a small order of fries.  

The fries were alright.  Thick cut, not soggy but not very crispy.  The pizza was pretty bland.  All the toppings advertised were present but it had no taste. I felt like I was munching on something that was neither salty, spicy, sweet nor sour; it was bread with cheese and a medley of vegetables I couldn't taste.  Kinda reminds me of a frozen pizza you would get at the grocery store.

The total order was $17.33, a reasonable prize for filling food but not very fair for bland quality.
author: Honest J.

description: ridiculous. ive been waiting for over two hours for my food and i had placed my order half an hour after they opened. i had called an hour n fifteen minutes after, dude says drivers on the way. now its an hour after and still nothing. called 25 minutes ago, says again drivers on the way and hell be here soon and theyre busy. i was a delivery driver and understand when it gets busy but this is just awful. finally got here 2.5 hours later just a little warm and not very good
author: Caitlin D.

description:
I wish Yelp had a percentage grading of establishments. There's just no room for *nuance* between 3 and 4 stars.

See, I thought Taraval Pizza's pizza was better than serviceable; the crust was puff, medium thick, a little soft on the inside but with a crisp, bubbly outer layer.  Cheese was good, as well as the toppings, which were fresh and low on grease (with sausage and pepperoni, you gotta watch for big butt plugs of fat jammed into them)--this was a combination pizza, so I got a sample of their veggies.

I wasn't wow'ed, but I rarely am by pizza--not that I don't like pizza, but it sure seems like places aim for serviceable and let it go at that. I haven't encountered "outstanding" in years, I don't think.

Anyway, these guys had some good qualities to their pie, but it wasn't A quality. A solid B. I'm going to call them a 3-star joint, which I'm a little reluctant to do because the likelihood that I'll be in the Inner Sunset anytime this decade is about nil, and I picked up rather than had delivered, so I wasn't able to review one of their core services, so they could---for all I know--be a 4-star or a 2-star place, but I'm going for the average and saying that, if I *were* in the area, and needed pizza, I would certainly give them a call right off.
author: Martin W.

description:
One of the best around parkmerced, the food is ok, you can't expect much from a pizza place anyway.
The delivery guy is always rude, i will never tip him well.
author: Abner P.

description:
Yesterday, I felt like death. It still baffles me how I can vomit so much, and then continue to vomit. It's a mystery of science. Around 1:30 pm, I knew I needed some food to help cure my hellish hangover, and of course the perfect food was pizza. 

I was REALLY excited about this pizza. As in, I almost hugged the delivery driver, but decided against it since a.) I was still wearing the night before's black eyeshadow and glitter smeared across my face. and b.) I think I smelled like puke. The pizza served its purpose as pizza (I mean is there really such a thing as bad pizza? Even bad pizza is still pizza after all) but it wasn't anything extraordinary. We ordered cheese pizza and garlic bread. The garlic bread was pretty much the chronic, but the pizza was missing something. Like other Yelper's have said, maybe it's seasoning or needs more sauce, but there is just something lacking. 

That being said, it is still cheesy pizza awesomeness, and I ate half of a medium, so they did something right. Or I was really, really hungover.
author: Jillian M.

description: so Taraval Pizza has been in the outer sunset for a while...it went away for a while then came back...the pizza is just ok....but the delivery service really, really STINKS...waiting for  over an hour, i called and asked if they'd forgotten us. "The guys right outside", says the guy. Well 1hr 30 min later no pizza...call to cancel the pizza the guy says " No no the guys coming right now !....yeah right ! Well you guys lost a long time customer forever. These guys have delivered to the wrong address...burned the chicken wings....you know the story on and on....bye Taraval bye-bye ! if you can't deliver TELL THE CUSTOMERS ! After reading the reviews it's obvious that they have no real delivery service and they don't really care about their customers....to bad, so sad ...
author: David R.

description:
My girlfriend and I did a taste test between a slice of pepperoni from here, seniore's around the corner, and irving pizza near my place.

Taraval won.  Purely because they put more sauce on their pizza and we're sauce fans.  Seniore's had a more nicely constructed slice, but Taraval's was just better.


service takes a long time though
author: Daniel C.

description:
The wings. Oh my God, the wings.

The pizza was good, pretty average, but the fact that they deliver late and can follow simple instructions (don't ring the doorbell, call my cell phone) that surprisingly many delivery people fail to do, plus the amazing wings, make me a fan.

Get the wings, eat them with ranch.
author: Julia S.

description: Living in the sunset makes food options difficult.  I have been getting pizza from another place on 19th Ave.  Stumbled into Taraval Pizza tonight and got such better service and pizza than any other place in the Parkside area!!  The employees were very kind and gave us free beers for the pizza wait. The pizza was hot, and tasty!  Honestly the best pizza I have had in the Parkside area.
author: Alaina T.

description: Wow, these guys make a substandard pizza. Takes way too long and I watched the staff handle food in a gross and unsanitary way.
author: L M.

description:
5 stars. That's right! 5 stars for a little hole in the wall pizza place. 

I have ordered whole pizzas from place and had them delivered. maybe 3.5 stars 

I have ordered pasta from this place, 3 stars (gnocchi was sooo soft!! sauce was so odd)

I have ordered calzones 4 stars (cheese was good, ham  and cheese was good, chicken and cheese... not a good combo)

and... i have ordered slices from this place. 10 STARS!!!! Omg i don't know what it is but ordering a slice from this place and then driving a few blocks back to my place while it cools to the perfect temperature... I can't describe how amazing it is. I get cheese (i am a pretend vegetarian and rarely order meat so don't ask about other toppings) and i put red peppers on the bottom half and leave it plan at the top. This to me is bliss. And it is soooo cheap!!!


One side note. I would take a star off, but omg their slices... 
one time i ordered online (grub hub i think...) and got my usual and said i'd pay with cash because i didn't want to type my card in blah blah blah. When i get there, i said i was paying with card. I don't understand why this was an issue, but it was. Maybe there is something with online ordering where they have to pay a fee or something, but the guy seemed really annoyed and told me to never do that again. I told him i'd walk to the bank less then a block away and i am honestly surprised he didn't make me. Sooo if you order online, just type the damn card number in. jeeze!
author: A. H.

description:
The Pizza here is floppy, Chewy, And nearly sauceless.  The dough is thick and sometimes feels undercooked and squishy. The toppings are meshed into the cheese and not topped on the cheese like actual TOPpings.  
It's basically a round cheese bread. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who is serious about their pizza. That means if you are a Yank and are here on business or pleasure avoid this place and save your money. You are much better off Going to a grocery store, ordering DiGiorno's and popping it into the oven yourself then buying from this over priced, bin. 
The delivery guy looked sketch and almost scarred. Probably of getting jumped which i know happens often. He got his tip. Its not his fault. Its the Chef's who clearly can't cook up a decent pizza. Sh*t cost me over 17 dollars. unbelievable.. and it has only 1 $ on yelp?  ridiculous.. That's at least $$.  Safeway got DiGiorno's for 4.99 a pie. much better buy.. Never again.
author: Vinny T.

description: Pizza is usually ok. But they shouldn't bother trying to deliver. Two times, twice wrong. and both times was 2 hours to get here. I'm not going to try them again.
author: Step S.

description:
Closest thing to a NY slice I've had in San Francisco.
They ruined the first one with extra cheese, so I requested the second one plain.

If I lived in the area, this would be my place.  Way better than Seniore's around the block.  It's cheaper too.
author: dan s.

description: I ordered a large ATHENA, which consisted of pine nuts artichoke, with a pesto sauce to go.  They accepted my cc and took about 15 minutes to bake.  The pizza was better than average.  I ate 3 slices.  Two slices too many and had to skip dinner.  I was stuffed.
author: Lai L.

description: I love this spot. I live very close and eat here a lot. Staff is awesome! They always make the best pizza for me and let me hang out when I'm too drunk to make it home. Taraval Pizza for life!
author: Tyler P.

description: $2.50 for cheese - thin with good crust and tangy sauce - thumbs up!!  Small place, beer and wine.
author: Jeff J.

description: Best Pizza in Town! So Fresh, So Delicious! Thank you! Will def be back soon!
author: Cheryl S.

description: I'm overall a fan of Taraval Pizza (despite its nickname in my house - Terrible Pizza), I dig the mozarella sticks and my mister likes the wing and pizza combo, but the delivery time? Just ridiculous. They quote you at over an hour yet still fail to deliver on time. I'm waiting on a 20 minute late delivery as I type this!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
It was a late weeknight evening and I had a craving for some greasy food.  I was too lazy to go grab some food by driving, so I looked up a pizza shop nearby my house.  I decided to try Taraval Pizza.  I was not sure what to expect as these pizza shops are always a hit and miss.  
 
I ordered a pepperoni pizza . . . thin crust.  I'm not a fan of too much dough, so I always get thin crust.  I decided to spoil myself and I ordered a slice of cheesecake.  The pizza arrived about 45 minutes later, which is the average time for a pizza joint delivery, even if you may live 5 minutes away.  
 
The pizza was good.  There was a good amount of pepperoni and a generous amount of cheese.  I hate it when pizza joints are so skimpy with the pepperoni.  The crust was crunchy and I had no complaints.  The cheesecake was really good!  To be honest, I enjoyed the cheesecake more than the pizza.  Please do not think the pizza was not good, but the cheesecake was much better.  
 
Would I order from here again?  Probably not.  I am loyal to Seniore's Pizza and Irving Street Pizza.  Sorry Taraval Pizza . . . you were sort of a . . . hmmm . . . one night stand.
author: Manton R.

description: We really like this place. My toddler's favorite spot for a quick bite as we head to McCoppin Park.  Individual pizza slices are nice,  big and delicious too.
author: Camille B.

description: The pizza was good... other than the fact that it was 2 hours late and cold. Thankfully i didn't get it with cheese so it didn't matter that much. I called the guy at the place THREE TIMES... each time he said it would be 10 minutes and to give the delivery guy a second. REALLY????? Thats such bs. Never ordering from these douches again.
author: Elly S.

description:
Ooh so sad to see this place w anything less than 5 stars! though in their defense whenever i get their food to go it isnt the same for me either.

i definitely suggest going in to this place and getting just a slice. topic depending it is between $2.50-3.50 but the best part is that they make it right then unlike most by-the-slice places where you pic from their options. here you just tell em and they throw it together and toss it in the oven. crust is delicious and the slices are very big! 1 slice and im definitely stuffed (though i am a girl. lol). 

one good plus to this place is that they are open very late & they're family owned. they know both my gf & i when we walk in :) always a plus. downfall is that they only accept cards if the total is over $10 so w/o cash we usually get a soda, beer, & cheesy bread w our slices to bump up the total to around $11. great deal though! :)
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Went walking near by to find a pizza joint for a slice when we stumbled on this quaint little place. The service was friendly, the menu is extraordinary(variety wise), and it taste really authentic. Overall this out does the place I love to go to back home in arkansas. Returning customer as long as im in San Francisco.
author: Erin L.

description:
I've ordered Pizza from this place twice, and both times it's been very good.  Every time I look at the menu, I can't decide between the marco polo, the toscana, and the garlic chicken pizzas.

Somehow, I got the Marco polo both times, so I haven't tried the other two.  I didn't even know I had gotten the marco polo the first time, until my friend said that this was the same pizza we ordered last time.

For a group of 5, I ordered the XL Marco Polo Pizza and  the Chicken Pesto Pasta.  It also came with free Buffalo Wings when I used a coupon.  The total with tax was $37, and I tipped them $4 for delivery, so it was $41 in all.  Delivery took about 30 minutes.  I think it's a few dollars cheaper if you call in and order rather than ordering off the website, but I was being lazy.  It's kinda expensive for pizza, but their Pizza was very good.  The crust is thick, but puffy.  Martin described it perfectly, a little soft on the inside but with a crisp, bubbly outer layer.  The pasta, however, was more liquidity than I would have liked.  It also needed more chicken and more flavoring.  The food was barely enough for 5, so I think next time, I'll skip the pasta and order a second small pizza.  The free buffalo wings were also pretty good, moist and medium spicy.
author: Tyler C.

description:
Taraval Pizza delivered to our motel room! The pizza was hot and had ample toppings; nicely seasoned sausage, a deeply savory pepperoni, black olives, and nice, thick, chewy cheese.  No heartburn, not greasy.  Well done, Taraval's.
Good quality and value. Make sure, if you're not at home, to ask for plates and forks!
author: Carol D.

description:
Sometimes it may not seem like it...but this place can make really awesome pizza.

I had this combo of some sort, with sausages, pepperoni, olives, mushroom, bell peppers melted cheese. The crust was soft but crispy, so delicious..man I scarfed that thing down like nothing!

Hands down I would pick this place over Senore's. The guys who work here are very friendly and know what the hell they are doing. And best of all they are open till the wee hours so you are able to get your pizza craving taken care of.
author: phillip w.

description:
this place sucks! super small store and the pizza is WELL below average. 
A waste of money forsure.

If I could do half of a star I would .......
author: Lauren N.

description:
My quest for good pizza in San Francisco Continues. I tried Taraval Pizza the other night and it was very disappointing. The crust tasted like those pillsbury ready bake breadsticks, all doughy and no flavor. The sauce was highly acidic with no real tomoato flavor, but the worst was the cheese.

We ordered slices from pre-made pies and the guy in the back prepped them by adding more and more cheese to the pie. I'm not sure if he did this on purpose or because he was so deeply involved with talking to his co-worker that he did not realize that he added a 1/2 pound of mozzarella to a slice of pizza.

What we received were four slices of warmed over, oily, greay, gloppy cheese pizza that had no redeeming features whatsover. Domino's would have been better.
author: joe f.

description: Hands down best pizza in the outer sunset, or indeed, one of my top anywhere in the US. Don't even think twice.
author: Jack R.

description: They have good wings.  They had a nice heat to them.  But they are baked not fried, which is not how you cook buffalo wings.  The one probem is that they were delivered wrapped in foil and the skin stuck to the foil.  They might have been baked in the foil.
author: Mr Buffalo Wings S.

description: Delivered and I gave the guy $40 for a $25 order. I asked for $15 back as I had four ones to give him for a tip. The guy fumbled with the money, asked me to wait a second and went to his car and came back with ones which he gave me. I didn't count it before I tried to give him $4 for a tip (believe me I will count change before I ever give a tip again). He said he didn't understand and walked back to his car. I thought it was weird so I then counted the money he handed me and it was only $7. I ran to his car and told him he only gave me seven when I asked for $15. He gave me two dollars in quarters and said he didn't have any more change. A few bucks is not a big deal except when someone is being shady. I called the restaurant to let them know I would be writing a yelp review for which they offered my next order half off. Then they called back and said they spoke to the delivery guy and he said he gave me $12. Not unless 12 suddenly equals 7 ones and eight quarters. In any case, the delivery guy came back to give me my change (which I appreciated) but then he argued with me and said he gave me "quarters worth a dollar". I had all the money he had given me and showed it to him. He shook his head as if I was lying. He asked me to give him back the ones and quarters, which I did, and gave me $15. I swear I heard him mutter liar as he walked away. I was still going to give him a tip for making the effort to come back and correct the mistake but not after being called a liar over a few dollars. I can appreciate the effort to correct a mistake but it was negated by the delivery guy's implication that I was trying to swindle him when he's the one that made the mistake!
author: E A.

description: Best pizza place ever! Thank you for the good service and for the good pizza! Try it. You will not regret!
author: Amer M.

description: Cheese was good as were the toppings. It was tender yet not too oily which can't be said about a lot of pizzas. The crust was a bit too dry and thick which sadly took away from the rest of the pizza. Friends of mine raved about it so perhaps I expected too much. Still, this is a neighborhood joint where you can get a decent slice.
author: Z L.

description: Great for some late night dinner! I have eaten here multiple times and the quality of the pizza has varied. My favorite is the California Combo. Ordering for take out is quick (about 15-20 minutes). What really makes those place great is that they are open an deliver until 2:50am! That's why it's so great for a late night dinner.
author: David D.

description:
Let's just say, I'm *not* a very big fan. 

I'll work with the pluses and minuses here, a la kevo. 

(+)
Pleasant service
They do slices ($3-$4) 
They deliver

(-)
Soggy doughy crust
Soggy mushy tomato sauce
Preparing a slice takes 10-15 minutes

Something about just throwing on toppings onto a cheese pizza an calling it a 'hawaiian' pizza just doesn't work for me, somehow. 

Sigh, my 30 minute lunch options are so limited here! But even then, I'm not sure if I'll be back.
author: M'ia K.

description:
We stumbled across Taraval Pizza as we were cruising for a new dinner spot. Taraval Pizza is a carryout or delivery place. There are no tables there for dine in, however, there is a counter with 5 stools. 

The price is very fair and Taraval Pizza has in house coupons available. The owner is very pleasant and seems to know his regular patrons. As we waited for our carryout pizzas there was a steady stream of customers purchasing pizzas by the slice [$2.50/cheese, $3.00/1 topping]. 

The pizza was tasty!
author: Rich W.

description: I got a pizza from here and the crust was completely soggy.  I couldn't even pick up a slice with my hands.  It was pretty gross too.  The toppings were not distributed evenly and one part of the pizza was covered in mushrooms and another section completely covered in bell peppers.  It's like the person who made it didn't care at all.  save your money and embarrassment of serving this to anyone you know and go to seniors down the street.
author: E M.

description:
Taraval Pizza sucks Donkey balls. 

Here's the pros and cons:

+ They deliver
++ They deliver even to a bar
+ Pizza is pretty good
++ Pizza is even better cold the next day
+ Price is reasonable. 
+ Pizza was made and delivered very quick

(- twenty billion stars) Delivery guy thought I was too drunk to notice that he kept $10 for his tip on a $20 pizza. Notice I say kept. He didn't give me change and then I tipped him. He kept the fxxxen money. He kept $10 and gave me a $10 then  hesitated and was reaching in to his pocket for more CHANGE but said nevermind and walked out. This was no mistake. It was no accident. There is no way to mistake giving change for a $20.17 pizza when you're given TWO $20 bills. 

Attempting to take advantage of a drunk person you don't know is horrible. You really don't know how coherent they are. I wasn't drunk. I was feeling pretty good. But far from drunk. Far from not noticing a huge chunk of my change walking off. Do you try to take advantage of your granny because she's old? NO! It's wrong. 

Let me make myself clear: Taraval Pizza sucks Donkey balls.
author: Kevo M.

description:
Ok, this is based on a delivery order thanks to Grubhub.com.

It was late, 9:30 on a Friday night and I just got home from work.  Crap, who delivers?!  I pull up Grubhub to see what I could dig up.  "Hey, this place looks OK.  I'll try it....."

Service was pretty quick, I will give them that.  The food came hot as well, but that is where the good news ends.

My fried cheese sticks were overcooked and stale.  My manicotti was greasy and very, very bland.  My french bread was burned and stale.  But the cheesecake was pretty good.

I woke up sick a few hours later, it definitely was the food, I hadn't eaten anything else all day.  I think it was the grease, but I can't be sure.  But man, I was really ill.  Never ever again will I try this place.
author: Jen K.

description:
We order an X-Large half and half pizza on monday night for an movie showing.  Things seemed to be working out pretty well after I got off the phone with them.

In honor of this being the home stretch of baseball, here are some strikes against them

Strike one: An hour later...no pizza.  I call and am told that they couldn't find my apt and had written my phone number down wrong.  Ok, no big deal at least it is on its way.

Strike two: another 20 minutes rolls by and still no pizza. I call and am told "Oh, its on the way".

Strike 3: I go outside to ensure delivery.  Driver finally pulls up and delivers pizza.  He even throws in an extra free 2L of coke to compensate for their lateness......however, I am not looking to do much tipping for an 1.5 hour delayed pizza.
