I give him the amt and he hands me change in bills (no coins) as I as take it, he still is holding tighting the remaining money as if he expected to get all of the small amt of change back.  I leave him with an $1 tip.

Your out:  the pizza turns out to be the wrong size...we order XL not L

So suffice to say, I am never ordering from them again....believe me I understand stuff happens but the lack of communication over the delivery and the prolonged wait didn't help matters on their end.
author: Shaun O.

description: I haven't been this place too many times, I've been here enough to give a honest and legit review. Why are some of you calling this place a resturant? They only have 4-5 stools, and the pizzas are meant for take-out/delivery. The ingredients aren't too fresh, but they are sure fresher than my grandma's plastic lunchbox made hours earlier in the day. I just come here and grab a slice of 3 toppings combo for less than $4, and I'm a happy camper. Seriously, if I were the owner, I'd make sure I get some better and fresher ingredients, that's the only weakness I see.
author: Dickson N.

description: Not enough sauce but good consistency bread and OK meat. Service was good and fairly speedy. I wouldn't go out of my way for this place. It's OK for a quick snack when I'm in the area.
author: Eric R.

description: These guys are always nice to me, I can call and order my slice ahead of time so when i get there it is all ready to go! They serve beef pepperoni which is awesome and tastes oh so nummmmy :)
author: Nadia I.

description:
S.F. Health score: 96

Symbol of Excellence:  Yes

(Brought to you by the S.F. Dept. of Public Health, because I think you have a right to know).

I ordered the Veggie pizza for delivery.  I think the guy said 45mins (and we don't live too terribly far) but it took over an hour.  On top of that I was starving.

But the pizza came and it was delicious.  Not hot, mind you, but good.  Plentiful assortment of vegetables.  I hate veggies and I even enjoyed this pizza (after picking off the onions and peppers and artichoke hearts, and all the healthiest veggiest).

I guess I'd order here again if I wasn't in a hurry.  Or drunk.
author: Kimiko Q.

description: This is my go-to pizza delivery place. Their pizza and calzones are awesome, and they delivery much later than anyone else worth mentioning. Highly recommended!
author: Zach B.

description: I had a completely normal experience eating here in a good way.  I ordered to go, completely normal call, guy who took my order wasnt rude or servile, just totally normal.  I went in and picked up my order - 20 minutes after ordering.  The place was clean, not crazy clean but not dirty.  The dudes settled my bill and I watched the end of the Raiders Niners game there.  The service was all around normal, or in other worda GREAT - I dont want any trouble, dont try too hard or not enough please, and thats exactly what I got.  The pizza was good, the crust was especially good.  I got the Athena, I really liked the pesto sauce.  I wanted more eggplant, but I got a lot of feta.  Really I cant complain about any part of the experience.
author: Mitchell M.

description:
I remember the good old days. When the fat owner would make the pies nice and appealing for people to actually want to eat. Each slice nice and warm and delightful...Those days are gone forever unless they hire someone to make good pizza again.

The place is now under new owners because the old guy decided to sell and move to sunny and smoggy Los Angeles. Good for him, not for us. I kinda made the mistake of not looking for him when I stepped into the joint one day. I ordered a slice of supreme. Usually, takes about 5...maybe 7 minutes. The key to this is par-baking cheese slices and pre-slicing them. When someone orders a slice of something, all you need to do is add some more cheese to the bottom to melt everything together, add the proper toppings and a little more cheese to make things look better. Sounds easy, no? Well, my slice came out looking like someone took the cheese off the sides of my slice. Talk about skimping on the toppings. And boy did it take them a while to get it to me. I was outside waiting a good 15 minutes. Nasty dry on the inside and the crust was too doughy...Bleah!

Now, I am a glutton for punishment so I might venture to this place again. Not sure when but soon. Maybe...Maybe I should bring some back-up with me next time...
author: Anthony L.

description:
The Hawaiian pizza is delish. It actually has canadian bacon AND real bacon pieces which is awesome but one time they didn't put the bacon pieces on!!!(WTF-maybe they were out?) Good balance of crust and sauce. Also, the pizza wasn't greasy at all- big plus.

The first time I ordered from them they were late by about 30 minutes but whatever, the pizza was still warm so I didn't care. 

This is a good place if you're not in a hurry and it's much better quality than dominos or pizza hut for sure. 

Next time I plan to order a calzone or some appetizers. All in all, not bad minus the lateness.
author: Julie M.

description:
Seriously? 45 minutes to deliver a pizza when I'm just two blocks down the street? 

Their pizza dough is also too fluffy. I'd rather go to Brother's.
author: Morence L.

description:
Their margherita pizza is just perfect after yet another rainy night. their pasta however is nothing to write home about. I'm happy they're open late and deliver, but I often want a salad with my food, and theirs are pretty basic. 
plusses though, the delivery guys are nice, and really, the simple pizzas on their menu are the best. The more complicated ones seem to throw them off and they arrive less perfect than desired.
author: Shelley C.

description:
This didn't get 5 stars because of the minimum purchase for card, but I guess that's partially my fault for not carrying cash...but the hot ham and cheese was awesome! After being violently raped and transferred to SF by my company and having 48 hours to choose from FOX TV's "SF's Shittiest Apartments IV--Live!!" (I live at the Villans ParkMercenary) I found Taraval Pizza to be a relatively good place to get a sandwich since I live nowhere near all of the Great Places To Eat in San Francisco and frequently set off the Don't Have Enough Money To Eat Here alarms when I actually am in proximity of aforementioned places...

Anyway, the ham and cheese was great, wrapped in foil, tossed in the pizza oven, dressed properly with not too much mayo and handed to me just long enough to soak up its own juices without getting too soggy before my first bite...good comfort food for a new transplant to SF..considering all that's really near me is the crapola at Stonestown. Anyone with proper sandwich recommendations would be welcome on my friend list!! :)
author: Sbicy Meatball J.

description: Greatest Calzone I've ever had. They season it so nicely on the top, and its nice and big. Better calzones than north beach man.
author: Amy S.

description: This pizza spot is good.  I come here when Senoire's is packed up the ying-yang.  Their pizza by the lice are made to order and is made with pretty fresh ingredients.  They open late...till 3am...a definite plus.
author: Patrick C.

description: Sadly there isn't an option to give negative stars or less than one. I like their pizza don't get me wrong, but when "Matt" starts cussing at me over the phone over a blown order and refuses to fix it, I'm done. I hang up during his little offensive rant, and he calls me back to finish?? Great service guys, really. Luckily I know what real customer service is, and it never includes calling a customer back to finish a tirade you didn't feel was finished. Good job "Matt," you just lost my business for good. The sad part is I've known Ray and Joe the owners for years, but all it takes is just one experience like this to change everything. Please feel free to tell "Matt" to F*** off, as he felt the need to tell me, twice. I will be ordering Senores from now on.
author: Nicholas A.

description:
we just wanna let you all know we have  very good pizza and pasta  and  wealways work hard to be better so we appreciate your opinion  .....so if you like us give a good reviews it help us fix what you guys dont like about us 

taraval pizza team!
author: Sameer B.

description: Surprisingly pretty darn good!  I did not have high hopes coming in here but needed a snack. A fluffy crust but tasty.
author: Emily W.

description: We were staying near by and were looking for.a quick bite. Stopped by this place to order their Greek Pizza. The pizza came out just right and their ingredients tasted very fresh. If you're looking for something quick for a good price, don't miss out.
author: Lior A.

description: Had my first slice last night. They are open late and I love that. The pizza had the right amount of cheese. The crust was crispy where it's supposed to be and soft where it's supposed to be. Prices are good and they deliver all over the Sunset. They also offer pasta dishes. Don't get the garlic cheese bread.  Not the best.
author: Lauren N.

description: 3.5 stars for this pizza joint.  There are located right off the L stop which made it really convenient to my friend and I.  I noticed the $10 minimum for cc orders and noticing my pockets were a bit low on cash, I ordered a Small cal zone.  I noticed that they made it fresh on the spot which was a plus, and got me excited to try it out.  The wait ended up being about 15 minutes. Just enough time to catch the next L-Perfect.  Get it home and my Cal zone is absolutely huge.  I should have guessed when the small was $11.  It's all good though I can eat! I felt that it could have used a bit more sauce, or at least give out more sides of sauce. I got two cups of sauce with the order and ran out halfway through.  Additionally the flavor of the sauce was a bit lacking, it seemed like it was straight canned tomato sauce, you know the kind I can get at Food Co.  Still, it was hot, fresh, and fairly tasty, and for that they get my respect.  If i am in the area I would frequent this place again.
author: Jason O.

description: Excellent toppings and cheese. The chest was a little doughy but not bad. Big slices!
author: John H.

description:
Back in high school I use to come to this place a lot with my football teammates, after going off to college for a few years and coming back to see how things have changed, I can say this was a surprise. Not so much in a good way but more in a "man I'm use to so much better quality" kind of way. The best comparison I can make about this place is that it tries to mimic how New Yorkers make pizza. This crust, along a thinly made pie with decent toppings. The only problem however is that the quality never gets high enough for my satisfaction. I cannot justify spending 20 bucks on a pizza that makes me want to vomit after. The amount of grease on the pie is evident and the people who make the stuff make no effort to conceal this fact. They try to offer different items on the menu to offset this instead like asking me do I want to add a salad. Don't make me laugh. The only time I truly see people in here is late at night when they're drunk and don't know any better. That or they don't wanna spend more money on better quality or wait in long lines at Seniore's up the block.

Honestly I wouldn't want to come back here for any reason whatsoever. Maybe if nothing else is open and I'm desperate for a pizza but overall avoid this place and try something better. It'll be worth it in the long run.
author: Jason Y.

description: They should change the name to "Attitude Pizza".  Decided to stop in and get a couple slices around 2am after searching around the Sunset for a place open and selling food.  I was the only customer in the place and everything started out nice enough.  There were about 5 guys working at the time.  The kid at the counter took my order and said I would be about 5 minutes.  Just hung out an waited.  I went outside for a few while I waited and after about 10 minutes came back inside.  I was still waiting for my pizza.  All the guys in the kitchen kept staring at me.  The short guy talking on his phone with his headphones in kept looking at me and was nodding his head at me as to say what's up?  I didn't say anything because I didn't really realize he was addressing me until he took the headphone out of one ear and says "what's up, do you have a  problem?"  I only said "just waiting for my pizza" and the kid said "oh I already took his order". So the dude turns around and doesn't say anything else to me.  A couple minutes later I get my 2 slices of pizza that took about 15 minutes to receive.  I was like "what's with all the attitude?"  and they all just stared at me so I left.  I don't really know what their problem was but I was just waiting and never indicated I was annoyed or anything was wrong.  I was actually in a great mood up until that point.  Btw the pizza was horrible and tasted like rubber and cardboard.  I'll never go there again because of the food but the bad attitude made me write the review.
author: Kevin N.

description:
It's interesting to see the bad reviews on this site, because this was some damn good pizza. We stopped by at 2:00 am on a Saturday night (OK, Sunday morning) to get a late night snack. (I don't even drink so no, I was not drunk!!!)

I got a slice of mushroom, and my buddy got a slice of sausage. My girlfriend declined, on the basis of "it's 2am and we had sushi 2 hours ago, I think I'm good". 

The pizza that the slices came from did not appear to be pre-cooked like most places. They put a really decent layer of toppings on, not skimpy, but not overpowering, and shoved it in the oven. While we were waiting , I noticed several things. 1) Fresh ingredients, not from a can 2) they were pouring the next day's dough out, and beginning to make it into individual balls. No pre-made cardboard crust here!

And let me tell you, that crust was amazing. Perfect. I've had damn good pizza in New York, Philly, Boston, DC, you name it, and that crust was top notch. The sauce had flavor, the cheese was very good and the mushrooms were really good. My buddy's looked good too. 

My girlfriend, despite the protests of stopping here in the first place, decided to try a bite. Then another. Then another, and made a point of chomping on the outer crust too. 

We'll be going back!
author: Chris F.

description: FK the deliver man!!!! He took 2 hours to get to my place and he already added 4-DOLOR TIP BY HIMSELF on MY credit card bill!!!! When I asked him what took him so long he told me I NEED TO FKING CALL EARLIER and left without even one "sorry"!!!! WTF!!!
author: Jeff H.

description: Two slices of cheese took nearly 15 minutes.  The pizza was really pretty bad.  You are better off just getting a frozen pizza at the market.  It would be better.
author: Entertainment M.

description: Took nearly 2 hours to deliver a mediocre pizza with the wrong toppings.  Never again.
author: Garen R.

description: over an hour for a pizza from 1/2 mile away, then surly comments from driver.  even if you are starving late night, don't do it.
author: Kevin R.

description: Soggy french fries, tasteless wings. I am giving two stars instead of only once since I had them delivered, so maybe the fries were just old, but regardless it was no good, and also I did not try the pizza, so maybe that's good and I just don't know it. But don't bother with ordering wings and fries here!
author: Sevag D.

description:
after a hungover baseball game with my east bay living boyfriend who had to drive back to concord for his own softball game, we parted ways at pacbell park..him back to his car..me towards muni..i got off on taraval and by utter chance spotted this pizza place i have never noticed before..just a chance encounter..but oh emm gee YUCK with a capital Y

for one, the owner was super rude when i asked what kind of shrimp they use.sorry owner that i am a seafood junky and always make sure i am eating the freshest possible!! i ordered my slice and proceeded to grab a drink when some guy walked in and began ordering. i would think the owner would tell him i still had to pay but he went ahead and ran him up and took his sweet time. before he took this guys money, he touched pizza behind him!!! GROSS

for two, the wait was forever...i mean gosh!!!! and when this pizza came, i was regretting coming here altogether. pizza was super bland, no flavor.i have had bomb pizza in my beloved SF but this was just nasty.dough was tasteless cheese was mediocre and the sauce tasted like it didnt have that good sauce flavor that i was anticipating..im not returning..
author: Mariangeles C.

description: OK here's the secret to Taraval Pizza.  They make great calzones.  Shhhh!!!!!!!
author: David S.

description: I wished Yelp had a negative zero because this place straight up deserves it! I usually give very nice reviews but not this one! Anyways a slice was cheese pizza cost $3.Must be kidding, but I was super hungry and did not wanted KFC. The workers were kind of rude! So I ordered my ONE SLICE OF CHEESE PIZZA and there were about 3-4 people in the back and they never thought was to make my pizza until 5 minutes after I ordered. When I ate the pizza it was disgusting! Not enough cheese and the dough was VERY PUFFY! Too much yeast! Shit! if you are running a pizza place you should know how to make pizza! I hope this place shuts down!
author: Janet Z.

description: I remember coming here during open campus for lunch in hs and back then the owners were really cool. Now, under the new management, it aint so great anymore.. The pizza my friend and I ordered was so small and it didnt feel that delicious when we started eating. felt like it was from the frozen food dept...wth were we eating?!
author: Jason C. J.

description: I come here for pizza by the slice if I can't find parking on 19th for Seniores.  Forget about coming here during weekday lunch hour, too many Mustangs.
author: Dong T.

description: really only go there when i'm drunk and it's 2 AM and nothing else is open, since i live pretty much across the street. don't mind it much then, but in retrospect their pizza is pretty bad. also what's up with the guy that owns it, he creeps me out.
author: Monika S.

description: the pizza is ok, and you can't beat the hours in this town. however, the delivery person asked me if i was irish after presumably not receiving a tip from me which was included in the total quoted on the receipt. and this is after i asked for my change, which he conveniently forgot to issue in the first place!! what's this chauvinistic BS?!
author: Adelie P.

description: Bravo, you tiny little ball of deliciousness. You are open till 3 am, and suffice when the munchies get to be too much. You have friendly staff, who love to smoke cigarettes outside, which is pretty awesome as well, and you delivery. There online ordering sucks so call them, they give you a liter a cola when you spend 25 bones, and holy effing christ there calzones are ridiculous, absolutely ridiculous, they make me want dance George Michael style in pastel colored clothing. Pastas, pretty good, pr-etty, pretty good. Taraval keep on keeeping on.
author: Joe R.

description: Decent pizza if you like your pizza doughy and fluffy . The buffalo wings and mozarella sticks were good . The jalepeno poppers were okay . Takes them a while to make the pizza .. but overall , this is a decent place to go . Way better than Senior's which is like two blocks away . However , there's only room for like 4 people to sit .. so don't plan on eating here .
author: Eileen L.

description:
Okay--I'm getting to know pizza parlors way too well.  When I want grown up food, I have to find a parlor that sells by the slice.  These guys did very well by my kids.

When i ordered for my kid's b-day party, they were fine but the pepperoni and sausage were hard to find.

Still--the sauce was good.

I'll go back for the kids.........Peace.
author: benwa h.

description:
Definately a place to hit up after closing time at Grandma's Saloon or Shannon Arms, both of which are within stumbling distance. 

The owner gave my friend Rick and I a healthy styrofoam cup full of wine from a box immediately upon walking in the door of this place at 1:00 a.m. on a Friday night. Can you say 'enabler's dream?' Consequently, I was instantly reminded of years spent sucking down 'space bags' of the stuff back in college. 

The pizza here is just ok, the combo slice has an interesting mix of meats (sausage and pepperoni) and veggies (green peppers, olives, mushrooms) and the crust can be slightly wet and doughy. Not preferable, but satisfactory in a pinch. 

The service was friendly and quick, and they didn't seem to mind our obnoxious, liquor-induced slurring, which is of course, a staple of most patrons who frequent this type of 'late-nite' greasy spoon.
author: Alex G.

description:
my favorite pizza in all of sf. very nice guys, nice little shop, parking nearby. very doughy and huge portions. 

BONUS: BACKLAVAAAAAAAA
author: Samantha G.

description: This place was one of the few places open on NYE. After a fail at Safeway, we staggered home to find a menu for Taraval Pizza on our doorstep. Sweet Synchronicity!! Not only were they open but they still delivered. The pie itself was actually really good. I was surprised, actually. I expected the 2hr wait on NYE but when it finally arrived it was great. Unfortunately, we had all passed out by the time it arrived. Not that it would effect my review. I loves me some pizza and the combo of hot pizza and late night NYE delivery at a good price means I will call them again. Hopefully not when I have no other options. I recommend this place whenever you need a hot tasty pizza at your front door. It was a great ending to a great night.
author: Greg H.

description: I been going to this place for a while now so I think they deserve a good review from me. The 5 stars is just for the slices alone. I use to go to Irving pizza a lot and sometimes to Senoires after hours when nothing is open but this place got the BEST SLICES in sunset. I always get the combo and hawaiian slices. Comes out crispy, hot with fresh toppings and plenty of fresh cheese on it. Big slices. The bad thing is that the last 2 times I came here, they were lacking sauce. I picked up the usually last night and noticed again they were lacking sauce. I want to keep ordering from them so I called them last night and told them about the sauce issue. I said "hey remember me, I just picked up a combo and hawaiian slice?" He said yeah. I told him about the sauce and he said " oh sometimes we are in a hurry so thats why" I told him I wanna continue ordering from them so I just wanted to let them know. He said "no problem, I know you have been a customer for a long time, we will take care of it so next time there won't be a problem". Even with the lack of sauce, the slice was damn good. Fresh toppings and crispy ass crust. To all the 1 star reviewers out there, you should at least give them another try with a slice. You can thank me later.
author: Vinh T.

description: Great pizza. Very reasonable price. Excellent service. The greek pizza is the BEST.
author: Cynthia C.

description: THE GUY GAVE US FREE BOXED WHITE ZINFANDEL!!! You cannot beat that.  Three stars for the pizza, which is really just mediocre.  The owner was really cool though, for giving us free wine and encouraging us instead of kicking our drunk, loud, obnoxious asses out of his shop at 1 am last night.  They take credit cards and apparently also do free delivery.
author: Rick H.

description: Extra points because the Owner is highly accommodating. Gave us free wine once...cheers for free wine, even if it is screw cap.
author: D H.

description: Foul-mouthed, incompetent delivery guy -- if that's what you like, Taraval Pizza is the place for you!  The night I ordered, the delivery person called me several times; he seemed to think he was at my building, but he wasn't.  I answered politely at first.  By the third call, he had asked me to come downstairs and meet him at the front door; I came down, but nobody was there.  Then he ridiculously claimed that he had been to my apartment and someone told him no food had been ordered.  (I was the only person here, and no one came to my door.)  Finally, I told him I had had enough and hung up.  The delivery person then called me a fourth time, and I chose not to answer.  He left a voice message in which he called me "the rudest bitch I have ever met in my life," an "asshole," and "the biggest dumb-ass that ever walked the face of the planet" and told me, "I hope you fucking die."  I let the restaurant's management know about this by way of the Web site I had used to order from Taraval Pizza, but I never got any kind of follow-up from the restaurant, let alone an apology.
author: Martin K.

description: I haven't been to this place in a while, even though it's just a few blocks away from me. Not because it's bad but we just haven't been eating pizza that much lately. They have a really good deal -- $19.95 for two medium 2-topping pizzas.  I think that's a pretty good price these days! The guys there are nice enough but at the same time, I don't expect 5-star service -- it's a pizza joint with a couple counter seats for petes sake! Still, they were accomodating when I added an item to my order at the last minute, and the pizza is not bad. Same as a lot of neighborhood pizza places. The guy that took my order thought I was in a hurry since I ordered in person to carry out, so he kept reassuring me that it was just a few more minutes and that he wanted to be sure to cook the pizza all the way.  Nice enough for me!!   I will continue to patronize this small neighborhood business.
author: Amy H.

description: Perfect when you just need a slice of greasy pizza, with a home-made type sauce... not doughy and too cheesy like Seniore's.
author: Jessica C.

description: I ordered pizza at 8:15pm and it did not arrive until 9:45!! then told me that it would only take 35 minutes...and when i called and asked where the guy was and how much longer he said "he is on his way" and hung up. i used to love this place for sit in, but i wont order from here anymore. rude and not on time. they have great pizza though; i just wish that they could pick up their customer service.
author: alyse l.

description: Recommended.  Excellent pizza and decent other food.  Service is good, not extraordinary.
author: Josh B.

description: The pizza here are all so bomb, and decent sized sliced.  IF YOU eat a lot get TWO.  Why three stars if i like it so much?  delivery is terrible.  Takes them an hour to two hours before you get your food.  They also require a minimum purchase before they'll deliver, but that is totally understandable.................BUT NOT WHEN YOU CHANGE THE MINIMUM EVERY FKEN TIME.  First time i called it was 10, then they said 15, then it went to 20.  no one likes liars.  don't order for delivery, go there and you'll be a happy camper.
author: Mike L.

description: so I'm a huge pizza fan (what 20-something isn't??) and I've eaten at a couple places in the city, but this is by FAR the BEST! 1 slice fills me up for a long while. amazing fresh ingredients, steaming hot, it's just perfect. I can't rave enough about this place. the only slight downside is the guys who work there have a shady look to them and don't always come off as that friendly but they are polite enough, don't bother you and get you what you want. If I had buttloads of money I'd come here every week. I haven't tried their other stuff on the menu, I'm too busy enjoying the pizza.
author: Kaitie D.

description: The bread is pretty good. If you like your pizza dough kind of doughy,  fluffy, and for the crust to have an overall mouth-filling bready kind of experience, you'll like the pizza here. They do a good job with the toppings, too. Really generous with them. The meat on the Hawaiian slightly overtakes the portion of pineapples, and the mediterranean is a kind of portable salad by the slice. Good times.
author: Joseph R.

description: Okay so I've heard some controversy that this place is better than Senior's pizza, which is like two blocks away.  So I put this place to the test.  I ordered a combo slice for $3.50, which came cooked to order within three to four minutes.  The cheese on the slice, was on the bottom of the toppings as well as melted on top to give the slice an extra cheesy effect which a similar characteristic with Senior's. However, their crust wasn't quite as good, although fluffy on the inside, the outside tends to crumble as I diligently ate around it.   Upon further inspection, I found that their oven wasn't quite the same as I was used to, with Senior's witch also effects flavor as well as texture.  Overall, the difference between Taraval and Senior's is mild at best.  Everything from the service (quick and friendly) to the ambiance (or thier lack of, i should say, as it is a very small pizza parlor), to the pizza itself is all very similar. You could trade one for the other any day, although I still prefer Senior's.
author: Erik P.

description: so i'll give it 2 and half stars. just looked up grubhub.com and saw what delivers to us out in the boonies.  well, it was between here and irving, but since there was pasta here, i chose this one. and never again will i trust pasta from them. gnocchi with bolognese. seriously this isn't hard to make, i just didn't have the time to do it. the gnocchi was overly mushy, no flavor. and the meat sauce was just weird, as in not good weird. IT"S MEAT SAUCE. even if you buy prepared stuff it shouldn't be that bad. the garlic bread that came with it stole the show, crunchy and delicious. the pizza (all shroom half pepperoni). slightly bland, needed to add a touch of salt. sauce was..not there? yeah, not there at all. possibly a spoonful was placed on the whole pie and swirled around. dough was eh. i have had pizza that was worse, so it's a 2 and 1/2 star type. i'd get it again if it was the last possible resource, very last resource. anyway, the wings, were breaded which i'm not a huge fan of but were ok. the mozzarella stick, you can't go wrong, were good but the marina sauce was cold. (?) maybe they forgot it's usually warm, yeah know, to go with the warm sticks. they did deliver it timely.
author: Abigail W.

description: Excellent pizza base, everything made to order, the service is kind of slow but the huge slice buried in fresh toppings more than makes up for the wait. My regular pitstop on the way home after a few cervezitas...better than the nearby seniores!
author: Adam O.

description: Really nice owner. He studied for years to make the sauce. Great pizza. Open late. I'm very happy with it.
author: Marc L.

description: I placed an order over an hour and a half ago when I called after an hour to check on my pizza they told me the driver was leaving then. When I called half an hour later frustrated because I've never had a pizza take that long he insisted on calling the driver before I cancelled the order he calls the driver on the walkie talkie where the driver said my address is next when the man on the phone asked the time estimate the driver said 10-20 minutes the man answered back he will be there shortly I said he just indicated another 10-20 minutes which would be almost 2 hours for a pizza. He then said no it will be only 5 minutes. Not only did I hear the driver the man lied. This is ridiculous! Who waits 2 hrs for a pizza! I told him to cancel it and hung up. They just called to say they were here an hour and fifty minutes later after I told them I cancelled the order. Thankfully I was going to pay cash. Terrible service!
author: Bridget W.

description:
so my friend went here, and wrote her first ever review because she liked it so much, so i had to try it.

we got a pie and my half had pesto, roasted eggplant and red peppers, pine nuts, feta on it.

holy lord, that was some damn good pizza!  i think i've actually had some dreams about it since!  i really must go back, and soon!

so, the place just got taken over by two guys, one of whom said he worked at, and ran, some other italian places in the bay area over the past few years.  i think they brought along something special here!

i will say, they clearly are super new here, as the menu on the wall wasn't what they actually have on the new menu.  this was a bit disconcerting, after picking something, then they show me the new little printed menus, but hey once i tasted the first bite of my slice, i didn't care,  yummy!

the pizza crust was just a bit like bread, definitely not a thin crust, but not too crazy thick either.  they put the dough on a layer of cornmeal after rolling it out, so it had just a bit of crunch and texture,  yumm!  and, it was damn filling.  i can usually pack it in, but after two slices, no matter how much i wanted to eat more, i really just couldn't.  

i highly recommend giving these new guys, and especially the pesto with roasted veggies ( i can't remember the name it had, marco pollo, or something?)  a try ASAP!  

p.s. best for take out!!
there is a counter inside with about 4 (i think) seats, but they aren't comfy, and it's literally 18 inches from the counter where people order!
author: Mom Of Three L.

description: Pizza here is so so. Better than Seniore's but something is still missing. The fried chicken wings are not bad, just alittle salty.
author: Happy G.
